text: Great and fresh food (had filet mignon and asparagus), quick and friendly service, and warm atmosphere are the reasons for my 5 star rating.  They were very busy for 9pm on a Tuesday night so the locals love it.  The bar area is good for dining too.  TV's with Baseball playoffs were good for entertainment.

I feel like Friday's food menu has gotten worse over the years. The alcohol menu - big improvements, I mean, who wouldn't want a 'Diddy Up' - right?!

This particular location is hit or miss with the waitstaff - some act like they love their jobs, others look like they hate their lives. Past couple of times I've been there the food came out lukewarm at best. Yesterday, it just so happened that I found a lemon seed in my Brushetta Chicken Pasta, after almost cracking a tooth on it, ew. Although, I will say, I just moved that bad boy to the side and acted like I never saw it. It's probably better that way.

The seating arrangements are like any other Friday's... booths, tables, a bar. Some of their 'four person' booths would probably be better suited for 2 people or perhaps small children - you won't find any arm room or a place to set your purse here.

Sometimes they run dinner specials - an appetizer, entrée, & dessert - somewhere around $11.99 or they've got some 2 for $20 deals.

I'll come back but only because it's cheap-ish & close to home.

87 West is awesome!  The decor and fireplace create a hip and cozy atmosphere.  I have been here twice now and everything has been delicious!  My favorite dishes:

the grilled four cheese - so many yummy cheeses and melted perfectly
the chorizo flatbread - super delish, perfect combination of toppings
the baked brie - love the combination of brie and sweet compote 
the carbonara - really good carbonara sauce, my only wish is that it had pancetta instead of chicken an bacon

The wine list and wait staff also added to the awesomeness.  Our waitress was super friendly, nice and good at her job. I will definitely be back soon!

Awesome burgers, great atmosphere, attentive wait staff. 

Ordered the Lola Burger and I keep dreaming of it so I must return soon. Also got a custom alcohol milkshake (vanilla bean and apple pie with bourbon), that alone was one of the best mixtures I've ever had.

We arrived during lunch on a Monday and was immediately seated. After arriving, the place was packed. 

It was my husband and I and he ordered the Porky burger and he is also very happy.

We complimented our lunch with Lola fries and onion rings...perfect lunch (not to mention our daughters name is Lola)!

Definitely a laid back atmosphere with awesome burgers (better than many places that state the same claim) and great beverages. I only wish it was closer to home!
Looking for a quick mexican fix?  Good food, lots of seating and if you want to get in and out quickly this is the place.  Not the best mexican around but not the worst either.

My experience today compelled me to write a review. I've been coming here very regularly and have raved to others about their long-lasting shellac.  Cindy is the best and one of her shellacs lasted almost a month! (With some tlc on my part).  They are pricey, which was previously my only issue. But worth it.  Sadly today I had my first negative experience and even more sadly it was with the owner Tina.  I requested a pedi and shellac and Tina worked on the pedi and mani, then handed off to Cindy for the shellac.  I was actually glad she did.  I know Tina is very busy which make me feel as if I wasn't being attended to and rushed- very rough pedi.  The salon had a bad bottle of Polish - color too thin - which I has picked out obviously unknowingly. I guess Tina thought it was mine because she spoke in a brusque tone about it and made me pick something else .  Only afterwards did she learn that it was their polish, not mine.  Perhaps Tina needs more staff so that she can focus on managing rather than doing nails because she seems way too busy to do a top notch job, which is what I've had from the other technicians up to now.  You guys are too pricey for anything else less than the best service.  Based on today I could have gone somewhere else and paid half the price for this level of service. I know you can do better Tina's nails.

Just wanted to say I can't be more happy with my stylist Katie Jordan. I love my color and my cut. She has a wonderful personality and great skills. You will miss out if you don't book your next appointment with her. Good luck Katie Jordan.

I had a reaction to the wax.  When I went back to days later to see if they had any recommendations.  They took down my information and told me a manage would call me back.  No call back.  I went back again after another two days.  The manage was there and couldn't be bothered to come out from behind the desk to look at my skin.  She was not helpful and her resolution was to offer me a complimentary service.  Really?  I don't want to go back to have your team mess up my face.  She comment to me "I am not a doctor.  I can't give you medical advice."  How does a business that offers skin care services not have a protocol in place to handle adverse reactions?  I am not upset at the welts the product caused on my face, I am upset that they didn't seem to care or have any remedies.  Surely, I am not the first person to react to the wax in this way.  Completely unprofessional mgmt experience.  Stay away!
Very very average.  No flavor. Overpriced.  Don't waste your time unless you're just coming for a drink.

Great burgers, killer onion rings and the best espresso milkshakes ever. The service was great and appreciated the manager stopping by to check in with us. The burgers were perfectly cooked. A great place all around.

Came here for lunch after shopping. I will never ever go to another T.G.I.Fridays. My server Marissa or Miranda would not serve me. The host Trent from the front that seated me had to serve me. I'm  sure this had to do with the color of my skin. To my put one star cause I needed it for this review. I guess I have to find another favorite restaurant.
My boyfriend and I eat here every 1-2 weeks. The staff is great and the food never disappoints. I would continue coming here even if I didn't live nearby.
Always friendly service. Amazing cheese dip with warm tortilla chips. Fajitas are never greasy. Been going here for years and have never had a bad meal.

Went last night with the family (6 adults and 1 baby).  Wait was long, but that's expected on Friday night.  Food was excellent. The new menu had good choices. We really liked the soft pretzels and the hummus for appetizers.  We had to get a second round of pita for the hummus it was so good.  The Caribbean rum ribs were great.  The pasta was also delicious.

87 West has a great atmosphere, awesome drink menu that changes seasonally and tremendous service! Donn was our server! He was knowledgable about the wine, liquor menu and the food menu! I highly reccomend the chicken salad sliders! 
This place does not allow children or babies, which is nice for an adult evening out! Fun place for a date or a night out with friends!

Why did I give this place one star...

a. I ordered a medium rare cause I'm low on iron (yay pregnancy) it came out medium..barely any pink. The man ordered medium and it was medium well so it wasn't a mistake. 
b. chili was so dry and lackluster
c. $30 bucks for to subpar burgers, fries and a shake

You should try
the bacon milkshake, which does taste like apple jacks
the spicy pickles from the pickle bar.

Saw this pharmacy was near by and needed a prescription filled. A CVS PHARMACY on a Saturday should be open, right?! Wrong! The pharmacy closes at 6 on Saturday. I asked the cashier who was sitting on her cell phone for assistance. Shouldn't have even bothered.

I almost never leave reviews but I felt compelled in this case, as the former operators were significantly better. I don't know what Sgt Clean changed in their drive thru wash, but in the two times I've been here, my car comes out with significant chemical streaks down the doors and fenders. I had to hose my car off and re-wash the door panels and hatch when I got home. Definitely not worth the $15 that I paid and I never had this problem with the old line.

1/2 price apps and happy hour all day on Monday. SUCH a good deal.

I came here yesterday for a quick early dinner with my boyfriend. We collectively decided that this was our new place.

I love the atmosphere. Everything is clean and open. There are even a few arcade games in the back to play. It has the ambience of a sports bar without being as grimy as a typical sports bar. 

Our server, Sara, was attentive and friendly. I ordered the carnivore tots. Have you ever put something in your mouth and thought "Wow, this is brilliant."? Yeah... this was that experience. Those tots are amazing. My boyfriend got pretzel sticks and cheese as well as buffalo dip. Both were amazing. Our food came quickly and was delicious. Our drinks were cold and refilled quickly! 

On top of the above average service and delicious food, the Monday deal was unbeatable. The price is amazing and this is definitely going to need to be one of my go-to spots!

I haven't been here in a while because eating here was like highway robbery.  Most of my family lives on the West Coast where the frozen yogurt craze started.  There's a system that is exactly the same at each yogurt store and no one differentiates from it.  Because it works.  Customers get their cup, pick their yogurt, scoop on their own toppings and pay per weight.  Usually you can get a decent sized cup with more than enough toppings for about 3-4 bucks.  
I don't think I've walked out of Spoon Me spending less than 5 bucks after all was said and done.  Unless I want a small yogurt with no toppings.  Everything is ala carte.  Toppings..extra.  Fresh fruit...even more.   
The yogurt tastes pretty good and I know it's not bad for you but with more and more yogurt places opening around here I probably won't take time out to stop.

I love EWC Crocker Park!  

The staff is friendly and personable.  All of my experiences with their waxing services have been nothing less than excellent.  I have a very low tolerance for pain, and I am always in the hands of true professionals whenever I am there!

Make a reservation, and see for yourself.  The Brazilian's are fantastic ans the eyebrow service is the most thought out and professional!  EWC at Crocker Park Rocks!

To once be a king is delightful but to be a queen? Burgers don't come with fries, nor any side of that matter. Kings demand a side to wash down such amounts of beef but this establishment foes not confide in those demands.

Terrible service. Understaffed? Whatever it was was rediculous. 8 minutes to get our drink order. Twenty minutes to get the app which we ordered when we ordered the drinks and was all we ordered. And the pot stickers were either freezer burned or undercooked in the dough. Not thrilled needless to say. And never choosing to come here again.

I was hesitant to purchase a haircut groupon after a horrible experience I had over a year ago, but decided to give Rometrics a try since they had great reviews. I am so glad I did! The salon was great, the people were awesome. Ann Marie did an AMAZING job on my hair - it was exactly what I wanted and it looks incredible. The shampoo and condition and scalp massage felt great too. Ann Marie was friendly and easy to chat with. A great experience and I highly recommend Ann Marie and Rometrics!
Nice higher end steak and seafood.  Have had many great meals here and if you are looking for a good steak you can't go wrong here!

HORRIBLE !!!
....burgers are small..fries are terrible...and management sucks...even though they 
have call ahead seating if their busy they will just give your table away...and they close early most of the time...

HORRIBLE !!!
....burgers are small..fries are terrible...and management sucks...even though they 
have call ahead seating if their busy they will just give your table away...and they close early most of the time... 2.0

This place is pretty tasty. I have been twice and have enjoyed my meal both times. I absolutely love their Lola fries. So light and yummy with the rosemary. I got the turkey burger once and the Chick Magnet sandwich once. Both were really good. Love the location in Crocker Park. Definitely will be back.

This place is pretty tasty. I have been twice and have enjoyed my meal both times. I absolutely love their Lola fries. So light and yummy with the rosemary. I got the turkey burger once and the Chick Magnet sandwich once. Both were really good. Love the location in Crocker Park. Definitely will be back. 2.0 new haha

This is the worst experience I have EVER had from a florist. I ordered a sympathy arrangement for family members in Ohio over 10 days ago. They still have not been delivered!!! The day after I placed the order online they called to get my cc info. I gave the info and later that day I received two more messages asking me to call back. I called each time and left messages. After a few days I decided to call back just to make sure that they weren't waiting on anything else from me and Jeff answered the phone and told me someone would call me back in 5 minutes. It never happened. I called again and left another message. Each time I called I either got the answering service or was told "someone" would have to call me back. After dealing with this for over a week I called them on Monday morning to try to get to the bottom of what had happened. Again I got Jeff and he was extremely rude and said he couldn't take my call right then because other calls were ahead of me (even though I was still waiting for his call back from 5 days previously!). He said he would call back in 15 minutes-no call. Then the manager Cathy called and explained she had been out of town for a week and apologized and said that she would get back to me later in the day. I left two more messaged that afternoon and of course no response. Called again this morning and same response. I would have given up long ago if they didn't have my cc info. I have just e-mailed them to cancel everything and hope that they will actually follow through with this request.
Bottom line is that everyone makes mistakes and I am more than willing to work with someone in that situation but Allyson's Flowers has not made one effort to get to the bottom of this fiasco. In my opinion , that's not the way to get  new business and even keep the customers you have.
Jets used to be the best but is slowly going downhill, tonight was so bad , I wish they go back to what it used to be

My daughter has some seriously wild and curly hair. I brought her to Paula for a cut that would tame her tresses. She knew just what to do. We left with about 3" of hair on the floor and a young lady with a big smile on her face. Curls set free! We love Moxie.

Unfortunately, I've moved too far away to make a trip to the Italian Cobbler feasible on a regular basis, but they always did a really great job!  I used to go there often to get the heels redone on my pumps - they always looked good and have lasted far longer than new heel tips done elsewhere.  I also gave them a tote bag to install a zipper.  You'd have no idea that the bag didnt originally have a zipper.  The owners are also very helpful.

Unethical business practices!!  I work for a floral shop and Allyson's called us and placed an order for delivery in April 2017.  They called us in December 2017 and said they wanted their sales tax reimbursed.  (A whole $3.08)  I explained that we would need the last 4 of the card # to research.  They gave me the wrong card #, then they called back and told me they disputed the entire amount with their credit card company so we are now out the total amount of the order.

Danny was not only early picking us up at both of our locations, but even took the time to take our pictures when we needed a group shot at our locations. Extremely personable, great driver, and even played music with video while we drove. Highly recommend his services!

Literally they deserve negative stars. I should have turned to the Yelp community before ordering flowers. This was my first time ordering flowers and will NEVER order from them again. I hope no one else does, either.

I live in Seattle, WA, looked up florists in the area and they came up. I called and asked if they could do a same-day delivery - she asked for the delivery zip code and said it would be no problem. She told me to place the order online and mark it for same-day delivery. I did exactly that and agreed to the $13 delivery charge. 

I get a call about an hour later from a fast-talking scam artist saying they had just moved their location and "Jeff" is on his way to the office to figure out what's going on but the driver needs an additional $15 to complete the delivery because the address is farther out than they expected (30 MILES!!!) Uhhhhh NO! How is the location 30 miles away from you when you are listed as local and when I called, there was no mention of an ADDITIONAL delivery fee. I said no way, cancel the order and asked for a refund. I'll give them one business day to give me the refund before I dispute the charge.

They are obviously not local, just posing as such. DO NOT ORDER from these people. Ugh!
Had the cake for a baptism, it turned out beautiful. I had so many people come up to me and say it was the best cake they ever had.

I was taken by ambulance to St. John's when I had trouble standing. The er staff was rude and would not tell you anything that was going on. 
I was taken for an X-ray and the person who was taking me hit just about every door frame when she tried to get through them. The person they sent from lab to draw blood must have stuck me about 5x before she decided to have someone else come to try it. They finally got what they needed and after the longest wait they said it was an infection and i was going to be admitted.
After they got me to a room, it was about  2 days before they got me started on iv antibiotics. Before that, they were treating me with Tylenol for the pain and fever.
I spent a total of 6 days there. In that time I think they got me up a total of 1 time for 10 minutes. I asked if there was a way to get washed up because I was so hot and sweaty from fever. I think that. Happened once. 
In the end, once they got infection under control, I was transferred to rehab for physical therapy. The staff there checked me over when they did intake and I had so many rashes and a few sores on my legs from sweat and not being cleaned properly.

Worst experience of my life!!!

Great food,  great service and nice cozy atmosphere. We have been to several of their locations and each time we were seated promptly, with server coming over with first couple minutes. 
Menu is on point. Everything is delicious from the starters all the way to the beer selections.

It's not often I send a meal back, but sometimes you just have to.  And when you do, the last thing you want is an argument from the manager.  Still great food (except the so-called blackened fish) but LOW CUSTOMER SERVICE by my standards.

Is it Little Italy quality pasta? No. Is it a good option for being quick and under $10 and in the middle of the Crocker Park outdoor food court? Yes!

Its basically build your own pasta with some prefab selections to choose from if you're lacking inspiration. 

You pick the sauce and the toppings (protein is extra). The creamy tomato was ok. The corn pesto was surprisingly good. The only thing you don't choose is the style of noodle, daily noodles are already prepared. 

You can take it to go (the to go containers were recyclable) or there's the outdoor bistro seats available as well.

This gym originally seemed to be perfect. I loved the atmosphere, the price, and the fact that they had two floors with many options to workout using all different kinds of equipment. This past month they closed suddenly. I was not informed of this situation, and had to read it on a note on the front door. I called the Broadview Heights location to cancel my membership (that was the closest gym they offered Westlake members to transfer to) and they said I had to email to cancel. I sent an email to them with a request to cancel over a week ago. I have still not had a response. My cousin who joined FX with me has already received a cancellation email. When they originally tried to contact me a couple months ago after I had to change my card they had on file (I ended updated them shortly after), they had the wrong number down for me and put my emergency contact as "fucking joke". I do not recommend this gym at any location.

Making the Moment was an amazing team to work with! Our photographer was Marcus and he instantly got our vision from the first time we met. He made the wedding planning process easy for us with his organization, quick responses, and creative ideas. Our whole wedding timeline depended on when pictures were going taking place throughout the day - Marcus instantly provided us a very accurate timeline when we requested it, which was 4 months out from the wedding (a lot of things can change within 4 months, but the timeline was spot on!).

On the wedding day Marcus was a blast to work with. He was there from the beginning of the day until the very end which was impressive! He still had the same energy from when he first met us in the morning as he did when he was packing up at the end of the night. The whole day was filled with smiles and laughter ... mostly because of his cheesy jokes between shots :) We can't wait to see the finished product!

We also had Jeanna for the Live Photobooth - I'll be honest, I second guessed having the photobooth pretty much up until the day of the wedding. However, it ended up being a huge hit! All the guests made sure to get some fun shots in and it was the talk amongst our different groups of guests when they were uploaded to the website to view. A handful of people even made the pictures their profile pictures or uploaded them to facebook to share which was fun to see!

Making the Moment was awesome to work with and I would recommend them 100 times over to anyone in need for photography!

Just had my first Jet's Pizza experience because of fellow Yelpers. And once again, I'm glad I listened. We got a large cheese 8 corner pizza for just $10. Had two slices and I'm stuffed! Very good. The crust really does taste like the old Pizza Hut crust. A little too greasy but I was told, "duh, It's pizza!" Good taste. Great price. A little sad they don't deliver to my house it is was worth the pick up.

My fiance and I received a gift card to Mezza from a friend as an engagement gift. We went this past weekend, right as the restaurant opened on Saturday. 

We were pleasantly greeted by a woman (owner?) who took our order and very thoughtfully made our meals: mezza gyro for my fiance and chicken gyro for me, both with fries. You could tell she really cared about making the food. She even brought us out samples of a new chickpea salad they had added to the menu and asked for our opinions on it. She seemed delighted to see how happy we were with our food!

The restaurant was clean and the food was awesome - I was a big fan of the tzatziki! I was sort of hoping the fries would be fresh cut versus store bought, but for me fries are pretty delicious regardless! 

We will be back!
Unless you're looking to do Zumba Gold, do not go to FX fitness! And I have to echo what other patrons said - filthy and outdated.
Foid is awful. Can't even make a salad right. It was disgusting.waiter was good but won't go again

Worst gym experience of my life. Went on a guest pass with a friend to try it out and got asked and almost forced to sign up before I even got in the door. Split level gym makes it hard to navigate workouts. On the way out I went to pick up my ID, the kid at the front desk wouldn't give it back to me unless I signed up. I almost had to go behind the counter and get it myself so I could leave. Don't go here

Ok, after reading other reviewers for this place, I have to agree that sometimes the food is really tasty but other times not so much.  It's still good at those times but not to die for.  I wonder if they have different people cooking on different days.

I say this because we used to get the 8 corner pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and red onions and turbo crust every week for a long time.  There were times the pizza was terrific but other times not so much.  I liked to say that a different chef was working that night.  Anyway, the pizza is still better than any other pizza we've had from other places!!

Lately, we have been eating the other offerings for a change of pace.  For example the Philly Cheese Steak Pizza which we found delicious.  Also, we get wings and salads sometimes and they are excellent!!

The bottom line is that this Jet's makes delicious food even when they have a different chef.

Went here around 9pm on a Saturday night for date and I must say that I really enjoyed this place! Clean and classy atmosphere with a little bit of cozy with the dimmed lighting. Staff was pleasant and attentive. Our meals started off with some fresh warm bread and butter. Very good, the bread had a nice crust but was soft on the inside. 

-Killer French Dip $17: I love a good french dip and this did not disappoint! Excellent portion size and very tasty! (Broth was a little salty, but whatevs)
-Pan Roasted Salmon $22: This was cooked perfectly! I am not usually a fan of salmon, but I had a couple bites of this, the skin was crispy and the inside was moist and delicious especially with that dill butter. The house mashed potatoes tasted like they had some garlic in them which I enjoyed as well. 

Sure this place is a little pricey, but it's also fancier and I think a great spot for a nice date night with your loved one (or booty call, no judgment here, everyone has to eat). I would definitely come here again!

I was referred to this office for surgery. Doctor was great and kind. And the surgery from my standpoint went fine. The doctor and medical staff get 5 stars.

However their front office as others have said need work. The woman who explains billing is difficult to understand because she has a very thick accent. I was told that after the $500 cash I brought day of surgery plus my insurance would be enough to cover the procedure they even told me in all likely hood I might even get a refund from the office after my insurance paid. Nope. I got a bill for an additional $300. And from all the complaints I've seen about billing mistakes this makes me think they got my billing wrong as well. 

Doctor even phoned the night of my surgery to see how I was doing and I thought he was wonderful.

We had a great server.  The food was brought to the table quickly and everyone loved their entrée.  We will return.  It is an easy spot to grab a bite and or drink before or after a movie at the Regal in Crocker Park.
Cute little ice cream shop with indoor and outdoor seating. Ice cream itself was not very tasty, but cute place to stop and have a snack.

The store is beat up and everything looks old. 

The hair stylists on the other hand, each are different....some good and some bad...but there is one stylist that is just plain rude, Valerie...she just doesn't have any common sense and tries to sell you products while you are getting your hair cut. And the worse thing is that she doesn't know how to cut hair. She makes comments here and there about how bad your hair is in order to sell you stuff. Just don't chose her. The other stylists would just cut your hair and respond only if you ask them a question...and most of them seem to know how to cut hair. I just don't recommend Valerie.

They are a fraud pure and simple. Can't post zero stars but that is what they deserve. They said they had their own location where I needed an arrangement sent but really did not and subcontracted the premium arrangement I ordered to a local supermarket. What they had sent was nowhere close to what I paid for. Wish I could post photos of the two arrangements Their service is an outrage. Have been trying to get them to correct this for two days but they are "too busy" to do so. Will send a replacement from a reputable florist and cancel the payment on this. I should have checked both yelp and the bettter business bureau first. They both have these guys pegged and say to stay away.

I was extremely disappointed with the customer service I received last night from the "Manager" Mike. I placed a call at 9:30 p.m which was not answered until 9:31 p.m. At which point I was told that they do not deliver past 9:30 p.m. I told them I had heard good things about their pizza and that I was eager to try it. He told me that there were "no exceptions, no delivery after 9:30...." I was then promptly hung up on. I then called back as I was going to order it for pick-up. I asked to speak with the manager and was connected again with Mike. After explaining that I was going to come in and pick up my pizza and informing him of my dissatisfaction in the manner the previous phone call was handled, I was hung up on again. I can't say anything about the food but I will say that I will never frequent this establishment and will stick to Romeo's. Who have always been friendly, respectful and punctual.

Sincerely,

Disappointed

This was a nice little eatery with an arcade in the back. It was fairly uncrowded for a Friday which was great. Nice family atmosphere. The pizza I had was thin crust and was just enough to share without leftovers. The breadsticks were good.

Awesomeness!  Chris & Weiland are amazing!  Karl and I agree best wings around. They make all their own sauces!  Wish this was closer to our house!!  We will be back!  
Back again. Love this place. Best wings we have ever had. If you get here before 6 PM, wings are 50 cents each.

This by far is the worst company I have encountered, I own a roofing company and have worked with many dumpster companies and contractors. We ordered a 30 yard dumpster , and specified that we needed it before 12 pm for Monday.We made payment before it was delivered . We have had the worst experience and called on Monday starting at 8 A.M and the customer service was very rude , and they stated they didn't know what time the dumpster will get there. We called every hour on the dot wanted to the status of the dumpster as well. They didn't though up till 1:30 P.M , and still didn't have an answer , while we got an apartment complex open, with inspectors, supervisors , residents and our roofers waiting. Then we said after hours after waiting we need to cancel and get an dumpster company, and they wanted to charge us $150.00. Worst company and pisses me off that a company that is so bad is still in business. They need to get out of business now !!!!!!

For about 2 years after moving to Ohio from NYC, I kept a tote bag in the back of the closet w shoes that needed repairs. I'd call my cobbler in NYC before a visit bc my turn around time was never more than 4 days. It was a HUGE inconvenience (gigantic pain - double parking, need I say more?!?!), but I didn't know what else to do. No one could recommend a place to me. (Apparently those in my Ohio circles don't repair shoes?!?)

One day, I had a GREAT idea - search the web (please don't judge!!). I came across the Italian Cobbler. I was hesitant, and like others brought a trial pair. I was VERY happy. My daughter and I are hard on our shoes. He always does a wonderful job. I am very pleased w the work. The "receivers" are *always* wonderfully attentive, informed, and never hesitate to say "Let me find out".. I very much appreciate the honest answers "Nope, not worth fixing" "You can do (a) or you can do (b), but if you do (a) and (b), you might as well do (c) which will be cheaper and is more durable." YES - tell me like it is! 

I've typically experienced a week turn around. One particular time I NEEDED only these shoes for a weekend out of town (which my then new puppy mistook for a bone...oh that hurt, the shoes were NEW). Bc I so very much *needed* only these shoes for that weekend, they said they'd work w me. I was promised the shoes in 2.5 days. The next day they called - DONE. The work was FABULOUS!

They're a bit more costly than I'm accustom to, BUT they're right here in OHIO (how convenient), the work is wonderful, they are informed about the work they do. I feel confident when I leave my shoes w them. And so very important, another lost art along w this dying trade, they provide EXCELLENT customer service. I feel valued as a customer whether I spend $150 or $8.50.

Came in from out of town with some Allen Edmond Fairfax Oxfords in chili that I needed re-edged and rejuvenated for a wedding. I dropped the shoes off on a Thursday afternoon, and picked them up the following day. The edge dye was perfect, and the condition of the leather incredible. The service was excellent - speedy, friendly, and very helpful. The price was almost too good to be true. I'd trust this shop again in a heartbeat, and recommended anyone who asked about my shoes that they give their business to The Italian Cobbler.
AWFUL SERVICE!!!!! Called one day and a child "Ben" answered. Couldn't even speak English! Absolutely ridiculous. Total scam artist

Brought my favorite Fossil purse here to be re-stained. It was originally black but I had used it for so long it was now a bad shade of gray. I had been unable to find another purse to compare so I looked into getting it redone. I was able to send them a message thru Yelp and someone responded to me within maybe 10-15 minutes with an estimate. I was impressed as it was late on a Sunday night! I took my purse the next Saturday and was told it would take a week or two. (Can't remember exactly). When I got my purse back I was impressed. It looked brand new. My only complaint was that the handles were still a bit tacky but was assured it would completely cure in a week. It took a bit longer than that but all is well! I will absolutely be using them again in the future. They were very thorough and answered every question I had and even answered questions I didn't think to ask.

We needed a last minute flower arrangement for the funeral of one of our neighbors. The person on the phone was very polite and understanding and offered help in deciding what to get. After we gave her the information on the funeral (date, time, place), she asked what we wanted written on the card. It was an arrangement eight of us had gone in on, so we wanted everyone's name on the card. When we arrived at the funeral home the arrangement was on display and much nicer than we had expected. Everybody's name was on the card with a nice sympathetic message to the family. I have dealt with other florists and have had bad experiences ranging from rude customer service to incorrectly ordered items. This place did it perfect! Couldn't be happier with the experience. Will definitely use again.
Awesomeness!  Chris & Weiland are amazing!  Karl and I agree best wings around. They make all their own sauces!  Wish this was closer to our house!!  We will be back!

Where do I even start....

We came here specifically for brunch. I realize it's called a Tavern and there's a game on but the TVs in the bar area were WAY too loud. You could hear the game no matter where you were sitting, including even in the bathroom. For a place that's fancy and a little expensive, I expect to not have commercials blaring in my ears while dining.
I ordered the French toast. Server came back later  to inform me that they don't have any French toast. Really? You only have a few brunch items and you don't have the only thing I wanted?! So, I ordered pancakes. The pancakes came with out butter. Very bland. Tasted no different than IHOP.
We also ordered the turkey chili. The turkey was very gamy. Almost like they use just dark meat. So I just ate around it. 
Also, we had to ask for salt and pepper since they don't keep them on the table and are only available if you ask. 
Floor seemed very slippery, as well.
Table next to us also sent food back. They ordered it without Horseradish but the food they received had horseradish.
Both of us decided we won't ever be back.

Was out shopping tonight with my family and we found Sweet Basil's on Yelp. Based on the other reviewer's recommendations, we stopped in for dinner. 

We had two house salads and the house dressing was highly flavorful. We ordered a small half BBQ chicken and  Queen margarite (quite close to a caprese style). I loved the margarite.  My kids unfortunately didn't love the BBQ chicken but primarily because they are more accustomed to Dewey's style.  
Overall it was a good experience though. Friendly staff. Good prices.  Game room for the kids after dinner. If you're in the area, it's worth stopping in for.

I went in and filled out paperwork to cancel my FX gym membership in Broadview Heights, Ohio. They fraudulently continued to auto debit out of my account. I called and was told I was no longer in the system because my account wasn't active and that a manager would call me to resolve the issue. I called back again after no one called me and talked to Sam who claimed my paperwork didn't exist, and I was magically active in the system again. This company cheats and steals from customers. BEWARE

I'm so torn with Burntwood.  I live and work nearby, so I'm here quite a bit and I wish that I loved it, but it is so hit or miss.  I've had great meals, and then I've had not so great meals.  The tater tots are to die for!  However, the burger I had recently was atrocious, which I would think would be hard to mess up.

I always veer towards local restaurants and this is one of the few restaurants in Crocker that fit the bill, but it is starting to become so basic and undifferentiated, that it almost feels like a nationwide chain.

My one big pro for Burntwood is their happy hour.  They offer a 7 days a week happy hour with half price appetizers, flatbreads, and drink specials.  It is nice to be able to come on a Sunday when I don't want to cook.
OMG!!!! This place is the best for shoe & luggage service their staff is very professional and friendly. I have had shoes and boots repaired at this location the owner foes all the work himself.

I will never take anyone in my family back here again.  Took my son in on the afternoon of Friday, November 2, 2018 for knee xray.  Doctor said he read the xray and didn't see anything but that it had to be read by radiologist to verify, and had to be done before we could be released.  After 3-hours waiting the doctor said that he didn't know why it was taking so long but we could go and he would call me once the radiologist provided the official results.  He asked me to sign a release and asked me to write my call back number on the bottom of the form, which I did in large numbers.  I didn't realize until we got home that the hospital gave me no paperwork.  I called the hospital the next day at 2:30pm and the nurse said that the doctor didn't get in until 4:00pm but she would have him call.  The doctor never called on the 3rd or Sunday the 4th.  On Monday the 5th, I called the Patient Advocate and was sent to a voicemail and I did leave a message and requested a call back.  No call back on the 5th, no call back on the 6th, no call back on the 7th.  I called the Patient Advocate, again, on the morning of Thursday, November 8th and, again, was put to voicemail where the recording stated, "all patient advocates are busy assisting other patients, please leave your number and we will call you as soon as possible," or something to that effect.  I left a voicemail and now sit here about 7 1/2 hrs after leaving a voicemail and I heard nothing!!!  So, what to do now???  I'm thinking about writing the hospital administrator or trying to get an appointment with the administrator but I have a feeling the whole hospital takes cue from the leadership.  You've been warned. (I have no idea why Yelp say that I am in SF, I am definitely on the westside of Cleveland).

The chicken gyro here is AWESOME. I get it with just the cucumber sauce and it's SO good. The junior size is plenty big if you're looking for smaller portion. The bread is delicious and you can buy it their freezer section. I use the bread to make the best small pizzas at home for my kids (tho the bread is expensive). The chicken is always great quality. The gyros are excellent too tho I'll preface that by adding I'm not a big gyro person. The owner is a lovely woman and she's always friendly. In the past there was an misinformed young woman working there who didn't know how to properly pronounce "gyro" and when I'd order she'd repeat "gyro" with the wrong pronunciation in a tone like she was correcting ME -- and that was annoying -- but that's small potatoes stuff. The food is good. The restaurant is super informal and casual. Go -- you won't be disappointed.

I could not have been happier with Making the Moment and how our wedding pictures turned out! Everyone was so extremely helpful, and Gabriella did such an amazing job capturing all aspects of the big day. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking in the area!

Definitely one of the nicest and chick units ive checked out in the Westlake area. If youre looking for modern, new, uodated and affordable, thus is the place! A must see place! On my possibilities list for sure.

I have been going here since the 90's when I was a little girl. Their bagels are THE best and I have never had a problem with service here. My family goes there about three times a month and we have never had a problem!

We need some SERIOUS help decorating our house and finding the PERFECT pieces! This place is awesome, has a beautiful showroom, and incredible selection.

However, the reason this gets a 5 star review truly is the staff and customer service. We were 100% ready to make some choices today, when our infant son got an upset stomach in the MIDDLE of their showroom! Rather than being mortified (it was gross!) the women were beyond accommodating. 

If someone's first response after projectile baby vomit is "no problem! We are family oriented.", that is next LEVEL customer service. They have our business for life.

I have never written a Yelp review before as I think no one will read it or I just haven't been that mad or that disappointed in a company before until now.  By dealings with Allyson's Florist absolutely warranted a post on Yelp of a bad review.  My Mom passed away in Seattle, WA.  I live in San Diego, CA and looked up flowers near where my Mom's service would be and Allyson's Florist came up online.  I ordered flowers to be delivered to the Burial site on one day and additional flowers to be delivered to the church on a different date for the Memorial Ceremony.  

The day of the Burial I received a phone call from the funeral home telling me they hadn't received the flowers for the Burial Ceremony.  I called Allyson's Flowers and they said they didn't have an event to deliver flowers that day but only for the day of the Memorial.  They said they called the funeral home and the funeral home told them there were no events that day.  I of course asked Allyson's Floral why they didn't call the customer (me) to confirm and they just proceeded to blame the funeral home.  The burial and the memorial service date/time/location were both on the funeral's website and the funeral home said all of their employee's have access to the calendar.  So 45 min before the Burial Ceremony I had no flower arrangement for the casket and all Allyson's Florist did for their snafu was say, "I'm sorry."  

"I'm sorry" does not cut it 45 minutes before the ceremony.  I asked to talk to the manager and they said he (Jeff) was out of town on vacation.  I asked if they could at least waive the delivery fee for this huge snafu and they said they would give me $10.00 off a $600.00 bill, really??  That was all you could do?  

I went to QFC and their florist saved the day.  She made me a beautiful arrangement in less than 30 minutes so I wanted to give a shout out to the local QFC grocery store/florist department for coming through on a very emotional and now flower snafu day.  Thank you QFC!

The other flowers from Allyson's Floral were delivered to the Memorial on the correct date and location; however, one of the bouquets were wrong.  I called the manager (Jeff) the following week and he told me he was not the manager.  Really?  He said Anna was the manager and she would call me back.  I spoke to Anna and she said she wasn't the manager but the manager did approve the $10.00 discount and she was "sorry" for the miscommunication. I gave up at that point to find out who actually is the manager.  Clearly the workers don't know or are hiding this issue from the manager.   

Unbelievable, you do not screw up flowers for weddings and funerals and then have NO customer service and NOT own your mistake and NOT make it right with the customer!!  I will NEVER use Allyson's Florist again!!  If I could give NO stars I would!

TERRIBLE company!  Allyson's totally screwed up my order for an indoor garden plant to be sent to my dying sister....sent a lousy Mum.  Did they care?  NO!!!!  
Demonstrated incompetence with the order and then were completely unresponsive & indifferent to my phone calls.  DON'T use this firm.......the seven 1 star reviews should tell you all you need to know.  I called them repeatedly and could not get anyone to respond, including the owner.   
One should expect more from a florist.  I'll be sure to let the local L.I. East Williston funeral homes, churches, etc know about this horrible company.

.           Discover the Wonders of INNER Space

Like walking through the pages of an exclusive high-end home interiors publication, expect to begin making a list of must-haves soon after arriving.  If you've never visited any of the Arhaus furniture stores, you're missing out on an impressive selection of upholstered and wood pieces, lighting, and many unique accessories.  One beautiful example after another.  At the Crocker Park location, I found at least 10 things I HAD to have. Fortunately, I don't really need them !---but I can't get a gorgeous computer desk/wall unit out of my mind---especially at the substantially reduced sale price. 

It's not inexpensive by most furniture standards, but worth stopping in even if you're closely budgeting right now.  If you like, you can very easily take a look at what's being offered by just pulling up their web site for a stunning preview.   http://www.arhaus.com/   You'll be widening your perspective in a very good way.   After some diligent planning and saving, you might soon be custom-ordering the perfect color in the perfect fabric for that perfect sofa---the very one you fell in love with just a few months before.

***  Watch for advertised store-wide ARHAUS sales.  
       There may also be unadvertised price reductions on 
       limited items in each store.  Call each location for any 
       special sale-priced pieces.    
 
***  The least expensive furnishings can sometimes end 
       up being the most expensive over time if you're 
       replacing the same item every few years.   Choosing 
       one of better quality materials and construction is well
       worth considering.    Arhaus ranges from $$ (sale and 
       some accessories) to $$$$.

***  If contemplating the purchase of any upholstered item 
       from a catalogue or internet source ---whether lower-
       end or higher-end---you won't be able to test for 
       springs, and seat, back, and arm padding.  Rather 
       than crossing your fingers and hoping it will be 
       comfortable, trying out the real thing is always better 
       and smarter.    


If I sound partial to Arhaus, it's because I worked here (another location) many moons ago.  I found a few of the same beautiful classic favorites, plus lots of new and fabulous additions.    Stop in and see for yourself !

I came to the hospital because I thought it was better then other area hospitals. The Dr. came in and without really looking at the hives on my arms, gave me meds and sent me on my way. I've had much better service in the past! I hope my recent experience isn't how this nice hospital is now!
Simply the best workmanship you will find.   I have taken shoes,  handbags,  suitcases etc to him for repair and they are always done with amazing attention to detail.   Prepay for your order.

3.5 stars (Yelp, please give us half-stars)...

Hail Mary's is a little sports bar in Westlake on Center Ridge Road in the old Frankie's (Fountain Grill). 

I checked in on a Saturday afternoon for some playoff hockey and day-drinking, and I had a really good time. It has a really nice "neighborhood" feel to it. 

I ordered some wings (just the standard mild Buffalo sauce) and they were terrific. I dare say they were the best wings I've had in some time. 

The decor is sort of a 1950's style diner meets trendy bar, with bar stools and seating finished in chrome with black cushions (1950's style diner) with a bourbon barrel backslash behind the bar (trendy bar feel). 

You may recall I said "...a little sports bar..." It's really small in there. The bar only seats 10 and there are a few tables that can maybe take another 20-25 more, but it would be pretty crowded in there at that point. Not a knock on the place, it is what it is, and they've made good use of the space. It's just lacking "polish" in my opinion to really give you that comfortable feeling. Maybe that will come in time as the place matures and finds its identity. 

If you're a local looking for a place to just hang out, Hail Mary's will probably be just fine. Good wings, friendly crowd and good service. If you're looking for an "experience," maybe you should keep looking.

Well, well, well -   I went searching for a flower shop in Everett WA.  I saw this one which indicate that it was in the Everett area.  I tried on line - and could not order flowers, so I called and spoke with a gentleman named Jeff.  Jeff stumbled around then told me another person would be calling me.  I was called back (blocked number) and - reading from their web site - order flowers for my newborn granddaughter (who is beautiful by the way!).  The flowers arrived to the proud parents and my credit card was charged.....more than what thought it would be and not by "Allyson's Flowers."  So I called the 1-866 number and spoke to Jeff once again. I asked where he was and he mentioned Westlake...I said "Washington."  He said 'Yes,' I then questioned my order - no order number had been provided (my bad!) and I had 'questimated' the charges based on my order.  Lo and Behold it was more than I thought.  I was told I ordered a higher cost basket and that was why my amount was more.  I gently explained that NO - I was reading right off the website and the one I ordered was not the one that was charge.  Long, long story - I was told by Jeff that my CC would be credited with the additional amount.  So I will wait and see.....if not I will call back.  My aggravation was that he indicated he was in the area I wanted, when in reality they are located in Westlake, OH - 2500± from where I wanted the flowers to go.  I incurred the cost of $17.95 for 'delivery' fee.  Lesson for me and everyone - really, really, really look at the name of the place and make sure they are where they say they are.  The basket was nice so I have no complaint there - however there is a concern about their integrity.  Will never try this route again.

And my granddaughter is still the most beautiful!  :)

After reading some of the earlier reviews - it appears $10.00 is the amount the 'credit' everyone.  People be aware - Not reputable - In my Opinion.

Horrible service.  I go to the club almost everyday.  Not once did the front desk guy tell me  that my membership expire and that they weren't able to bill my credit card because I had recently had it stolen.  Instead I was 2 weeks into my expiration that I got a letter from their billing service that notify me that not only did I owe the yearly membership, but my rate had went up from 100 dollars to 150 plus and on top of that I was charged a 5 processing fee and 20 dollar late fee.  Called and just got the run around.  I paid for the year but at the end of this year membership I will make sure to write my cancelation letter 30 days prior to my end date.  Horrible customer service.  Definitely make sure what u are charged for and if u sign up with a trainer make sure u read the fine print as my girlfriend had a horrible experience.  Their contract is for a year so if u try to cancel early to still have to pay.  Again read the fine print.  I have been a member of this gym for more than 10 years and I can say ever since it was bought out by red and then name change to fx fitness the owner ship has been terrible.  Do not recommend this place.  Just waiting to end my membership is august

Love it.  Always a great meal.  Portions are HUGE.  The patio is a great addition.  Small and cozy inside.  Nice beer selection on tap.....free pretzel sticks.  Nice place to start out if staying local then heading to ironwood or anywhere in Westlake.

Glen and his staff are world class. I own a shoe store (Arthurs shoe tree) in bay village and we trust him with any and all repairs we encounter. Wether it's leather work, a lift, a buckle etc we have never been unhappy with the quality or speed of there work. Thank you for being an the beta in the biz and helping us accommodate our customers and my family personally. 

Jeff and the Arthurs Shoe Tree Staff 

P.S. Oh and go just to see this guys trophy in the lobby. BEST COBBLER IN North America! Wow! Well deserved.

I purchased 2 BMW's here at the very beginning of 2018---one leased and the other purchased -- over $80k in autos. I've had a few minor issues with my vehicle -- had to bring it in 3x for parts, servicing and some electronic issues. They gave me a loaner each time---the first 2 loaners were filthy and the 3rd one wasn't exactly spotless. All 3 loaners were on 'E' --racing to the office-  I had to stop and immediately get gas for the loaner! 

They never have parts--my windshield wiper needed replacement and it took weeks to get in the piece. Winter floor mats I requested upon purchasing they didn't have either. I asked for them to be ordered and never received a call--stopped by a few times---nothing. 

I have a few electronic issues with the vehicle --they were to order parts---I had to follow up multiple asking if the parts had arrived...to finally get fixed only to have more issues, etc.

It goes on and on...this is suppose to be a luxury car dealership but their service department is substandard at best. How can you spell K-I-A!!!!!

I will think twice about purchasing a BMW from this dealership again...it all comes down to service for me...and they just drop the ball.

My husband purchased at Mercedes of North Olmsted - they treat him like gold---they are awesome -- so this experience with Westlake BMW burns me even more... because I see what a great service department can do.

I hope they read this and start to realize how to improve their service department.

We went for our company Christmas party and felt like we were an inconvenience to them. Waiter was good, management rude, food so so. Nothing special I've had just as good burger at Rusty Barrel. Calamari was a soggy mess. My co-worker said the ribs were good. Not worth the price for mediocre food and rude manager.

Let me start off by saying that I live a stone's throw away from Little Italy and have tried all the respective pizza restaurants in that neighborhood, and we still routinely make the 30 minute drive out to Sweet Basil because I think it is truly some of the best pizza in Cleveland. 

The slices are huge, but don't taste overly heavy or doughy. The ingredients are fresh and the seasoning is perfection. Two slices are enough for one person as dinner. The atmosphere feels a little bit more upscale and "farm to table" than your normal pizza joint and is a great place to share a pie with friends or family! Their takeout service is prompt and easy as well!

I am heartbroken over my wedding photos.  We told this photographer that our biggest priority in our wedding was the gathering of our family and friends.   This priority was completely ignored in the face of creative shots that captured whatever "energy" was interesting to the photographer.  I have six photos of salsa at the reception, and zero photos of my mother, the mother of the bride, at the entire reception.  My siblings, who were also the officiants, are featured in exactly one photo each.  My dad, the father of the bride, was only photographed while giving his toast.  We have four photos of a couple we are not even related to.  He took many photos of my dress, in each one you can see the bra sewn into it - therefore I have no good photos of my dress.  Of the hours of photos he took of me and my husband together, I cannot find one that I think is good enough to even post on facebook, let alone print and frame in our home.  Once again, I am heartbroken.  We will never get another chance to take photos from that magical day, and have no nice photos to show our future children.  I don't even want to show them to my friends.  Don't make the mistake I did.  Do not hire Making the Moment as your wedding photographer.

Working in Crocker park, I visit pasta co-op regularly where the food and service is always superb. Thomas and the rest of the staff each bring unique talent and provide world class service. Thom is always experimenting with the menu, creating new culinary experiences, which he and his staff deliver in a timely fashion. I would highly recommend trying one of his many pasta bowls, which come from house made pasta and fresh ingredients.

Best pizza on the westside!! Super nice people with fresh ingredients. If you haven't been, your missing out.

Simply put... they do pizza the right way!
Simply the best. Among all the places I've lived and all the cobblers I've used this is the absolute best, hands down. You can't touch the quality. You can't beat the prices. Highly highly recommend!

I lived in and around Westlake, Ohio for over ten years but did not discover this place until my last three years but I was thrilled when I did!  Having grown up in an Italian family, I am always looking for good Italian food - particularly good "gravy."  Frankie's never disappointed.  My two favorite dishes were the Manicotti and the house specialty, the Chicken Tosca.  The chicken is always melt-in-your mouth tender, and their marinara sauce the best!  Good portions for the price, too.  Too bad I moved to Clearwater, Florida a year ago but I recently came back to the area for a visit and Frankie's was my first stop!

I got off of work the other day and was just looking for somewhere to grab a beer. This was the first place I saw so I stopped in.

This place is great!! I actually thought I had been here before but I have not. It's very cute and I love the decor you can tell a lot of thought and effort went into planning out this establishment But it is very small. The bar sits maybe 10 people max. Then there are only a few tables inside but they have a nice looking patio from what I could see. But they are doing a good job of utilizing the space that they have. For this particular visit I sat at the bar. I would like to come back and sit on the patio. 

They only had about four maybe five beers on tap and they had some local beer so that was cool I just like more of an on tap selection per my personal preference. But the bottle list look to be pretty long so they have a lot of beer options. They also have liquor and I believe they have wine. 

I guess what they're known for here would be the pizza. All of their pizza here is thin crust which I am a huge fan of thin crust pizza. I got "The Breakaway" which is garlic, mushrooms, and a couple different kinds of cheese. I liked it and it was actually very well-made but it was missing something for me based on my personal preference of pizza I definitely would like to go back and try it again and maybe request some basil on top I think it would add a good bit of extra flavor. They have a lot of different pizzas that I would like to go back and try. I also hear that they have very good wings with some great sauces so I definitely will be back at some point to try that as well. 

Lastly the staff is wonderful. They are so friendly, attentive, engaging. I would come back here for the friendliness of the staff alone. Awesome establishment!

Don't order the pasta for the price point. It's insanely overpriced. We actually refused to pay for the half order of pesto mac and cheese add chicken because, for $7, it looked like a 4 oz. portion! I felt like I could make a $1 box of mac and cheese that would taste better.

And, onto the pizza, we ordered a large half special, half chicken bacon pizza with extra sauce all over. We paid extra for the extra sauce, but couldn't find it. Should have asked for it on the side so we know we get what we paid for. The server said it would take 15-20 minutes yet when we arrived and paid, the pizza was lukewarm. Darn!

If you live in the area it's a decent place amongst all others in the area.

Making the Moment was one of the best decisions we made for the wedding day! We had Gabriella and Autumn and everything couldn't have worked out more perfectly. The groom and I were put at ease, we had fun, and I felt so beautiful that I got over all of my nervousness! I can't stress enough, for prospective wedding couples, that feeling comfortable with your photographer will make or break the day with you. We spent 13 hours with Gabriella, plus many emails and calls planning the timeline. If I didn't like her as a person, it would have been a dreadful experience. We used someone else for our engagement photos and he was rude and awful and terrible to work with. I LOVED having Making the Moment with us for the wedding day.

I have epilepsy, PTSD, and dissociative episodes.  One night I blacked out, was unaware of everything.  Woke up in St. John's West Shore Hospital after my husband called 911.  I was in and out of consciousness for three days--mostly out--probably due to severe stress reaction I was having.  I was put in a unlit (almost totally dark day and night).  When I finally woke up, there were a doctor and several nurses around my bed.  I panicked, did not know where I was, tried to fight my way out of bed.  For the next three days, I was in restraints in the bed. Never explained to me why, when I could be trusted to be out of them.  Miserable laying in bed all the time.  Finally went home after three days.  Never will I allow myself to enter this terrible excuse for a hospital again.  No one explained anything to me, no one showed any concern.  And this is a hospital!
Waited for 30 minutes for a haircut, and when I got a chair, she couldn't get the look I wanted.

A pleasant surprise for good food and great service just across the street from the busy Crocker Park. The restaurant has a nice ambiance in the dining room. 

My family and I were well taken care of by our waitress. She was the highlight of the dining experience. I wish I could recall her name. Our waitress had a great knowledge of the menu, was accommodating, and friendly. 

The Friday night when we dined here they happened to be running a special for three courses for $25. This was an amazing deal with generous portions for a delicious dinner.

I started with a House Blend White Wine that was good and reasonably priced. The Watermelon Salad was a refreshing salad and more than enough for two to share. 

My main entrée was the Pork Chop that was described as having a glaze was okay. The actual meat was perfectly prepared as far as being a tender, juicy meat. There wasn't much flavor though. The cornbread served alongside was good. My Brownie dessert was delicious. 

Other good dishes at the table were the Fried Lobster Ravioli appetizer, Tuscan Sliced Steak, and the Chocolate Cake. I liked that the restaurant features some other local foods like Mitchell's ice creams for dessert and Ohio City pasta for the Fried Lobster Ravioli.

Awesome new salon! Congrats ladies on a job well done! I've been seeing Karisa for over a year and was excited for her (and friend) to open her own place. It's so comfortable and cute, and just perfect. I was in on a Tuesday and it was a full house! Going to be a great addition for Westlake. If you're looking for upscale with personable, talented stylists minus attitude, this is it!

I ate at the Fountain Cafe in Westlake Fountain a few weeks ago. It is Middle Eastern food. I enjoyed the food tremendously. It's a small family style restaurant. If you don't know what you want I suggest to try the Fountain Mixed Grille because it comes with a little bit of everything beef kabobs, shish tawook, chicken shawarma which is all served with rice pilaf and vegetables. Also try their humus & pita bread. The food was delicious and superbly cooked. They give you a lot of food, so if you get the Fountain Mixed Grille it is enough for two people.

We stopped here for breakfast and it was very good.  Nothing fancy, but they don't claim to be fancy.  Just good, home cooked food.  I got a maple ham omelet and it was really good.  The maple ham in the omelet was a very good combination with the eggs and cheese and hashbrowns.  It had American cheese in it and had I known I would have probably switched that out for Swiss but it was still very good.  My husband got scrambled eggs and sausage and both were cooked perfectly.  A couple of the other reviews of this place said that they could have made the same thing at home - of course you could have!  That is a dumb comment, in my opinion.  You can make anything you want at home, to be honest.  They do not claim to be some fancy, upscale restaurant but they are not a dump, either.  They are just a nice place to get some home cooked food for breakfast and lunch.  If you in the place you will not expect anything other than that, and that's fine.  They are what they claim to be.  The staff are really friendly and nice and keep your coffee filled.
Foods good bar food, atmosphere is tops, outstanding patio.  Service is always subpar unfortunately.

Love the food. However, they should really get the ball rolling on finding a bigger location with more available parking. And no I don't feel like driving all the way to Olmsted Falls out of my way just for that.

The staff is always smiling and welcoming and I always feel the price is worth the quality here. Sometimes I get a smoothie that's chunky or not blended but it's rare and doesn't change the overall taste.

DECIDEDLY AVERAGE

Our family group of 9 came in for dinner based in part on the high Yelp reviews. The pizzas were poor to average. The salads were sub-par and the service was lousy. Why all the good reviews? Is the competition really that bad by comparison?

And Faux News was on the TV. I'm sorry, but that's one demerit!

I have a bit of a shoe obsession.  I like precarious, gorgeous, high end, high heeled shoes.  BUT with great shoes comes great responsibility.  One must replace heels and tips regularly, repair worn elastic, condition the leather, cover scuffs and occasionally perform emergency surgery.

Just such surgery was needed when I snapped the heel on a 4.5 in. pair of YSL patent leather d'orsay stilettos.  (Originally $720, I paid $80!!!)  The Italian Cobbler told me that they just don't make replacement pins for shaped European heels that high anymore.  However, he had a few ideas.  He held on to my precious shoes until he had a chance to talk with someone who had an old one and was willing to trade.  He performed a miracle!  Now my beloved shoes look as good as new.  What was lost is now found!!!  Joy!!!!!

Since that time, he's replaced the stays in my Coach mules, the elastic in my Kate Spade kitten sling backs, fixed the heels on my Ralph Lauren boots and Vera Wang slingbacks, fixed the scuff on my Bruno Maglis and re-done countless heels and tips.

The only complaint I have is that his scuff and polishing work is not as good as the shoe shine guy in my building.  That's fine-- he can do the surgery, leave the cosmetics to my shoe shine guy.  So, give him a 4.5

I wish that I could give more than 5 stars to Making the Moment Photography (MTM). From start to finish, Brett and the rest of the team was by far the best team that I have EVER worked with. Each of them are so genuine and kind, you will want to work with them for many, many years to come.  

We worked with Brett and the rest of the MTM team for our engagement photos, wedding photos, and storybook. The decision to work with them was easy, even after just our initial phone call with Brett. Initially, we weren't sure about getting engagement photos, but are SO glad that we did. Not only did we get to "practice", but we had SO much fun and got to know Brett (and Sara!) which made our wedding day so much easier. Our photos came out incredible; we did not look like we were posing or awkward.  

Prior to our wedding, we worked closely with Brett to set up our wedding timeline. He almost acted as a wedding planner, and our wedding day was seemingly effortless. Brett was able to keep us on track with our schedule, without seeming the least bit pushy or controlling. He also came as early/stayed as late as we wanted them to. By the end of the night, we wanted Brett and Sara to put down their cameras and dance with us! Everyone always comments on how incredible our photos are and how they have never seen anything like them before. My husband and I felt SO comfortable, and it shows in our photos.   

Lastly, MTM's print studio is incomparable. Ordering is easy, using MTM's online portal, and the prints are reasonably priced considering the quality of the prints. We also purchased a custom made StoryBook and I am SO glad that it did. Being able to relive the day in such a special and unique way was so precious to us. It will be something that we can share with our family and friends forever.   

Overall, there are really no words to describe how thankful we are to have met everyone at MTM and can't wait to work with them again!

Had lunch at the Burntwood Tavern today. Stopped on a whim as we were passing by and decided to give it a try as at first look it had a nice vibe. The atmosphere is cool and we were welcomed right away by what I think was the owner or at least manager. I like the decor and the layout. It wasn't very crowded at 11:45, although the crowd was getting better as we left. I had the California Chicken sandwich and my wife had the Fish N Chips. The sandwich was good and my wife's wish was good as well. As far as the food is concerned the only complaint we both had was the seasoning on the fries was way overdone. They were too salty and overloaded with other seasonings as well. Luckily I didn't like them, because the portion of fries was puny. The service was decent; didn't wait too long but wasn't exactly quick. Friendly wait staff. Our drinks were topped off more than once by more than just our waitress. I would probably give it another try, but won't make a special trip at this point.  
Cheers

I was excited to come here cause I love pizza. Who doesn't? 
1. The door to the front door was open and it was 50 degrees. It was freezing in the dining area.
2. The garlic bread tasted like pure butter. No garlic taste at all.
3. The pizza was very bland. It tasted like a can of tomatoes was open and thrown on it. No seasonings at all.  I got the "The Special Pizza". It had olives, pepperoni, gyro meat, green peppers, and bacon. The gyro meat was tasteless. I couldn't even tell it was on their till I actually looked at the pizza.
4. The older lady we had as our waitress was not friendly. All she wanted to do was take our order and that's it. She never asked how the food was. I'm sure she is glad she didn't cause it was awful.
Honestly, Ive had better pizza at Pizza Hut. I did love the size of the pizza. The crust was ok. I liked the chewy aspect of it.

Julie the owner is hands on, place looks fabulous and food was good. Though pizza crust,  was darker than i like and took away from toppings. Every table is inches from other so you are quite familiar with others . Pizza on thin paper plates was a surprise, but hey waitress said the younger drinkers don't mind. So her unconscious slam on us late 40's/50's people should suck it up?  She asked what we thought

Good Mediterranean food for reasonable prices! The hummus was a bit more bitter than I like, but the food was overall very good. I got a hummus chicken with tahini and tzatziki sauce on the side. My better half got a spicey wrap of some sort (chicken) that she really liked. 

The dining room was clean and open. I enjoyed sitting and relaxing for a few minutes during lunch. Our food was brought to our table - nice touch! Overall, I would say that this is a great place for lunch on a fairly small budget.

Bagels taste good,multiple choices.
Didn't give me the choice of a warm up bagle.
But the waitress told me,they assume u want the cold one.

Dover is a great place for a total brewing newbie like myself. Each time I've been in, I've received friendly and knowledgeable service and answers to all of my stupid questions. When it came time to buy my brewing starter kit, upgrading a few items was no problem and we customized it to my specs. I look forward to return visits as my brewing needs (and, I hope, my beers) get more sophisticated.

The Italian Cobbler is a genius. I purchased a pair of jimmy Choo's and soon found why they were on sale. The toe opening was so tiny that after 15 minutes my toes were numb and pinched. I brought them to the cobbler. He cut new leather that matched beautifully. He matched the gold screws for the wood. He measured my foot so the opening was perfect. Voila!! My shoes are comfy and no one would ever suspect they were remade. Gorgeous. I highly recommend him.

I came here in August 2017 and it was my first weekend in Cleveland since I moved from Columbus. I was so happy to check out Crocker Park and to find Pasta to eat. This is an outdoor restaurant so seating is outside. I'm not sure what they do in the winter months. 

When I arrived, I was super hungry that day so this meal was delicious but I do remember that it needed a bit more flavour. It was a bit pricey for a medium sized plate to eat but since Crocker Park is a fancy mall then the meal prize makes sense. Everything tasted really fresh and my roommate enjoyed her meal too. I'll have to come back to try other menu items :)


****
This is my 142nd Yelp review overall. 
96 reviews for 2018.
I am aiming for 100 reviews in 2018.
Ate here on 18 August 2017.
Reviewed on 27 October 2018.

I took a tour, joined, used the facilities and learned that I was lied to multiple times in response to several direct questions, cancelled my membership -- all on the same day. The Westlake club did not cancel my membership and proceeded to bill me. I got the bills stopped for six months, now they have started up again so I have to waste my time with these losers. Oh, and they threatened to send a collections company after me too.

Mezza is excellent, authentic Mediterranean food.  It truly is a hidden gem over in Westlake.  I love everything from here but my favorite is the Chicken Club.  It's a chicken pita with bacon and two types of cheese and mayo and lettuce.  I wish I knew the seasoning they used on their chicken because I would make it daily.  so GOOD.  The owner is also extremely friendly - she talks to each customer like she truly appreciates their business.  Only downfall is your clothes may stink a little when dining in, due to the kitchen being right in the middle of the plafe.  I usually get carryout.

DOZENS!  I have easily rented dozens of dumpsters from these people over the past 3+ years.  So this is definitely a "voice of experience" speaking.  

Customer service:  very good.  Never had a problem charging it on my credit card, scheduling a delivery date or arranging for pick up.  I did have ONE time when it wasn't delivered on time. I called them and it was delivered later that day.  

Costs:  reasonable. There are cheaper places out there, but I'll pay to slighter higher fees for the service I get.  

Additional costs:  I think this is a problem, but not for them but rather for people getting small dumpsters and not realizing how heavy stuff can be. Sofas, dressers, mattresses...they can add weight big and fast. 

In summary, I am pretty confident with these people. I'm sure I'll be ordering at least another 10-12 20-yarders from them before the year is up.

I consider myself a cake snob. I am very picky about my cakes and cupcakes. I love this bakery. The cakes are always fresh. I love that I can walk in and buy just a couple of cup cakes and the are fresh. I have gone in and they have been out of something and they will go in the back and make me some fresh ones. They also have delicious cookies. They are definitely one of my favorites.

The website indicates delivery is $8.95 for same day delivery. However, they took my payment and then left a scrambled message on my phone. They didn't make the delivery of sympathy flowers. They never contacted me again, by phone or email. I emailed to confirm the delivery was made, but they didn't respond. When I called TWO WEEKS later to find out why the flowers hadn't arrived, they said it was "on hold" because the location was outside their normal delivery zone. They tried to ask for an additional $15. But the website specifically says flat rate of $8.95 delivery anywhere in the US! And the delivery location was in the middle of our town, not at all a remote location. So terrible. Also, they advertised as a local, family-owned business in my town. But, they are not local at all.

To be quite honest I had never heard of this place until my boyfriend suggested we stop and eat here before seeing a movie at Crocker Park. What a great find!

Right as we sat down a party of 40 was seated on the back patio and we still got our orders in a timely fashion- very impressed! I ordered the Crusted Pecan Salad with Chicken and Whoa! was it amazing! The Cranberry Vinaigrette that comes with it is absolutely delicious! I would buy a jar of it! My boyfriend ordered the Grilled French Onion Steak Sandwich that was equally delicious! I will definitely be back to try the pierogi melt that I had my eye!

Although I haven't had any actual treatments yet, I'm THRILLED with Timeless Laser & Skin care and looking forward to my first service. Dr. Christian (a very well educated self-proclaimed science geek) spent over an HOUR with me. I filled out a  questionnaire, which she read through in detail. She then gave me loads of advice based on said questionnaire, then discussed my concerns (of which there are many.) She then wrote out an incredibly thoughtful and detailed plan for me, and was just a generally lovely woman to boot. She's passionate about what she does and it shows. I'm sold. Dr. Christian, I put on my mineral sunscreen today, just like you told me, too. : ) Can't wait to go back and start on my plan! As a side note, the entire staff was super friendly as well. Class operation.

If you've never been here, def need to try it, being an UberEATS delivery driver is how I originally discovered the place, and the food smells so good I was delivering o had to try it...
