The Sweet Corn BBQ is amazing ... prob my favorite, along with the Spicy Shrimp Alfredo .... the food is made fresh daily and it doesn't  disappoint

This is one of my two must visit restaurants in Cleavland (the other being Salmon Dave's). A rare 5 stars. Try the Chicken Philly, and their fries are the best! 

Perch is always good, (OK, the grouper fingers were the only questionable thing I've ever had). 

On this week's visit I took someone who had not been to Cleveland before and we sat on the patio, perfect evening, and exactly what we were looking for. 

Needless to say, I'll be back again!

What a gem of a Mediterranean Restaurant!  My wife and I dined there tonight and was graced with a fine conversation with Mona, the owner and Chef.  We were filled in on the 13 year history of this family restaurant, and could not believe that it had slipped by us all that time!

I had the Mezza Gyro (pictured) and my wife ordered the Chicken Shawarma.  Both were outstanding!  The first thing you will notice about the Mezza Gyro is the amount of thick sliced gyro meat included.  It would be a meal for 2 or 3 at other restaurants.  It is perfectly seasoned, and the Tzatziki Sauce compliments with the freshness of the tomato, red onion and lettuce.  A fresh pita wraps it all up.

The restaurant is counter service with an open kitchen where you get the bonus of seeing Chef Mona practicing her art.  Table seating is available after ordering.  They have a few display racks with hard to find Mediterranean spices and ingredients. A nice touch for some of us trying to master this cuisine at home.

You will not be disappointed at Mezza!

Don't buy from these people!  My Aunt died and I goggled for local florist and this site comes up saying they are located there.  I buy flowers for over 100 bucks.  Flowers are delivered but don't look as nice as what is on website and the bill delivered with them show they only cost 60.00.  What a scam.  Don't buy from them!!

Poor facility, shady dealings.  Do yourself a favor and don't join.   If you do join anyway, be VERY careful to insist on seeing the paperwork BEFORE you sign.  They have you sign a computer screen and "tell you" the details but not important ones regarding cancellation.  Do not accept that they will email you everything after you are signed up.

Having to pay far more than I anticipated for a couple of months at a dingy gym with old, crappy equipment.

Shady, shady, shady.

I've visited this restaurant twice within the past two weeks and I've been very satisfied both visits. The atmosphere is upscale but relaxing and inviting.  I've been fortunate to have Juan wait on me both visits.  He takes your food experience very personal and goes out of his way to ensure you are satisfied the first time through.  Photos are from both visits. Food was fantastic and fresh, very flavorful.  I look forward to my next visit.

I am so impressed with the prompt online quote system and employees! Dumpster arrived and picked up as promised, no complaints. Already recommended to another friend and will definitely be using them again in the future!

The 8 corner pizza is definitely what you come here for. I think I saw they have personal pizzas too which sounds amazing. The crust is so crispy on the outside but so good and doughy in the middle. This is what you get when you are craving carbs. Lots and lots of carbs! Pepperoni and meatball are good choices.

I was in town working on a project, and stumbled into this place looking for a cup of coffee. I noticed their bagels looked amazing, and the prices seemed reasonable. 

Normally I check Yelp before I try new places, but this trip I had zero extra time, so I just went where ever was closest. I am glad I did not look at their previous reviews, because those are some petty assed reviews. I did not experience ANY of those grievances.

When my assistant and I walked in, we were greeted on the first day by a very friendly girl who patiently waited while I decided on which of the many choices I was to select. I ordered the spinach/egg/cheese everything bagel for $3.49. Freaking delicious (slightly too salty, but I am sensitive to that kind of thing). 

My friend purchased the bacon egg and cheese bagel, and she ate hers faster than I ate mine, so had to be as good or better.

Medium coffee $2.19. Very good.

So good in fact, that even though I was late going to the airport the next day, I HAD to stop in and get a repeat. On the second day, I was greeted by an extremely friendly young man, who was just delightful. 

The entire place was spotless.

The manager was extremely friendly, as well. I could not have asked for a better experience.

The worst and I mean WORST service! Gave this place three tries and zero of the three came out good. The owner isn't nice not is the staff. Too bad too bc the pizza is actually decent. I would rather buy a pizza oven and make my own pizza then order from here again. Rudest people on earth.
Delicious! The white clam pizza is amazing! Love the thin crust pizza here. Service is great and we will keep coming back!

DO NOT SIGN UP!!!!! They will never let you cancel your membership, I've cancelled my membership months and months ago and am still being charged. When I call to see why I am still being billed they put me on hold forever, when I go in to talk to them they give me the run around then finally tell me they will take care of it only for me to continually see charges sent to my card. Continual charges, no refunds yet.....

I've already spent countless hours between visiting in person (TWICE), sending certified mail, sending e-mails, reaching out to other FX facilities to track down a corporate or owner contact info, speaking with my credit card companies to report fraudulent charges, speaking with their payment processor to invalidate their continued payments after I've cancelled, etc. just trying to get away from this deplorable business - so I don't wish to take any more of my time out of my day to describe to you how absolutely horrendous this facility, the staff, and the equipment are, but feel free to peruse the countless other reviews and just know that I echo their sentiments. 18 reviews with a 1-star rating speaks for itself - take a look at how many other "not recommended" (due to the Yelp profiles being new) reviews their are too.

Caramel apples, caramel apples, caramel apples - Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory just has SO many to choose from. They come in traditional (plain or with peanuts) and a bunch of dipped varieties that include delicious candies like Butterfinger, M&M's, english toffee, etc. and other nut varieties (like pecan). Sometimes I think the extra toppings get a little overwhelming, don't get me wrong - they're delish - but my go-to is usually just the plain. Simple and delicious.

RMCF offers so many other dreamy chocolately options - including dipped marshmallows (with sprinkles! - it brings out my inner child, what can I say?), caramel pretzel bark (this is divine, you MUST try it), coconut stacks, dipped Oreos, chocolate covered pretzels, you name your favorite chocolate confection & they probably have it. 

The staff is always friendly and helpful and I love that you get to see them in chocolate dipping action from time to time since it's all out in the open. 

It's definitely on the pricey side - but if you don't go over board you can get outta there without dropping your entire weekly allowance. I promise.

AS i was out of state, my friends MOM died and i live in NY. I internet searched for a local Long Island Ny Florist , Allyson  Florist came up and my wife called and was told that our ordered Flowers were going to be Delivered as promised in two days notice to the local Funeral parlor, Before Funeral .. Allyson indicated that they had three locations and not to worry.  Two days later on the morning of the Funeral we were sent a message in NY , Requesting More money for delivery. As indicated in other complaints this company is not locally based and scammed us into trying to get  more money for delivery. They Guarantee one price. They did Not reach us so they DID NOT Deliver the Flowers to one of my dearest Friends Moms funeral. Even though we paid already.  I realize they are faking they are local when in fact , they are in different state , Trying to get money to contract flowers and charge extra.  Please Do NOT USE THIS SERVICE . IF YOU CARE ABOUT your Flowers for Funerals or special occasions call a better local company.  When i talked to employee at company about the delivery i was subjected to hostile, cursed rant, and hang up.  Please no matter what you do, DO NOT HIRE THIS SERVICE.  READ the other Yelp complaints. I will be complaining to the Internet provider and the Better Business Bureau.

Let me first say that my hair dresser was great. I liked her and she did a good job. 
My problem with this salon was the price. Most Aveda salons are non tipping so the price includes a tip for the hair dresser. This salon was not one of those salons. Normally that would still be okay with me except their prices were just as high if not higher than other TIPPING aveda salons.
My trim cost $40, my highlight cost $100, and then I was charged $35 for toner. So in total it was $175 plus tax then added tip. I've always gone to an Aveda salon and never have I paid that much. Aveda at Casals and Rometrics included tip and were lower than $150 for same service. Price does matter to me so this will be my first and last time to go to this salon. I, like most Americans don't have $200+ to shell out every 4-6 weeks just for hair.

So, after a bit of investigating, I find the owners, Geoff Levenberg and Amy Levenberg, to also be associated with Plantrex.  Allyson's Flowers is a scam,  which I have had the misfortune of being another customer who was bilked out of $109. Is Plantrex their real business, or just another fraudulent business façade?  I'm still checking!  BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!

I met up with 8 lady Yelpers (:D) for a supper club gathering on a Wednesday night.  The Fountain is a small, cozy restaurant in Westlake that occupies the building formerly held by Frankie's Italian Cuisine.  I wasn't aware that Frankie's had closed until I pulled into the lot.

Our server, Mohammad, was very welcoming and he did a great job of explaining the menu items for those that haven't had Middle Eastern/Mediterranean food before.  I had been to Aladdin's and Mezza (just a few miles west of The Fountain) before, so I was quite familiar with most of the food. We were the only table there that night for dinner, so service was spot on.  Unfortunately, they don't have a liquor license...boooo.  I ordered a Turkish coffee.  It was pretty strong...similar to espresso.  

We started off by ordering a bunch of appetizers for everyone to share.  They have a combo deal where you can choose 4 cold appetizers or 3 hot appetizers for $15.  We had hummus, baba ghanoush, Mahamarra, and tabbouleh, all of which came with pita triangles for dipping, falafel, kibbeh, Fatayer pies, and Barak (Obama) Rolls.  I honestly really liked them all!  The Mahamarra had a nice bit of spice to it, but nothing overwhelming.  

For my entree, I ordered the Fountain Mixed Grille - a nice combo plate of Shish Tawook, Chicken Shawarma, beef kabob, and veggies with a side of rice pilaf or bulgur.  It took a little while for the food to come out because they make everything fresh to order, but it was so worth the wait!  This was one big plate of meat!  Everything was juicy, nicely seasoned and cooked just right. (see uploaded photo)  I can't believe I managed to eat it all!  It was so good and I was pretty full so, I didn't have room for dessert.  The owner came out to describe the dessert options available. A number of the girls ordered dessert and they all seemed to like it!  (Check the photos) Maybe next time, I'll order a smaller entree, so I'll have room for dessert. 

After we were finished, the owner came to thank us for coming in for dinner and the Turkish chef even came out to say hi.  Everyone was very friendly and appreciative of our business.

It was a great evening of great food and friendly people.  I'll definitely be back!
The food is excellent and huge portions! It takes me 35 minutes to get to Mezza and the ride is worth it.

My wife and I were looking for a new place to try and we've always wanted to stop in Olmsted Falls. The moose head hook and ladder was a great option. The service was great, decor was fun and the food was awesome. Can't wait to go back. Dinner was followed by a nice walk around the town. Definitely recommend stopping in and trying the sampler platter. Pepper jack cheese sticks were so good stretchy and melty with just the right "bite". Pepper jack cheese after all. My wife had there French onion soup and I had a walleye sandwich. I'm house made chips made even better with being served with French onion dip.

If I could give -5 I would. THIS IS NOT A REAL FLOWER SHOP. "Kathy" is someone that call us, real florists do give us orders over the phone, taking about 30% off of YOUR MONEY people. We do not accept order from them EVER. Google up a shop and BUY LOCAL. Always. And "Kathy" is really rude and have no customer service skills at all.

This place is a hidden gem. It is the best Mediterranean food in cleveland, heck in akron, heck youngstown, canton and detroit have nothing  on this place. The food is amazing. Fresh and homemade from a spotless kitchen often by the owners themselves. Brings back  memories of Jacovs's from the east side. Just amazing. You would be a fool to not try this if you are anywhere near the cleveland area.

I've gone to Bella three times, always seen Dean. I go every 3 to 4 months. Love the haircut every time. I never feel rushed at the end while Dean and I are talking about any that needs to be done (more thinning out, bangs length...).
Consistently awesome! We've been coming here for several years, and won't bring our shoes anywhere else!

We had a wonderful experience with Sara and Making the Moment.  She was super easy to work with, organized, and enthusiastic about our big day.  We had a relatively tight timeline for pictures, and she was completely accommodating of all of our preferences.  She was also super fun to hang out with all day!  It was very obvious that she cares about and loves what she does, and that was reflected in our pictures.  They turned out amazing and we truly couldn't be happier with them!  Thank you again, Sara!

The team at Cleveland Chiropractic are amazing. They are very friendly, inviting, and make their patients feel like they are valued. Nicole and Lindsey are amazing assets at the practice. I feel that they not only are professionals but friends. 
They also do their best to always accommodate me. Dr. Vic really truly cares about my progress and always seems to know exactly what to do to make things better. He is not about the instant, fix but more in the long term fix which is exactly what I need. I'm so glad that I was referred to them and I am now a client for life. Thank you Dr. Vic, Dr. Yan, Nicole and Lindsey.
The average coffee place. Coffee makers weren't rude, but rather busy so they just got the job done. This one is in the Barnes and Noble, and does NOT take Starbucks gift cards.

Good service and good food! The quality is consistent and it's a better option than the fast food choices it's surrounded by and faster than the sit down restaurants nearby - nice to have a different option! The sweet corn pesto with bbq chicken and the truffle bolognese are my personal favorites.

Visited a few weeks ago on a quiet Sunday night...first impression wasn't very good. We only came here for appetizer and drinks - both were not great. We had the spinach artichoke dip - it only came with a few tortilla chips and naan bread slices on a board with the dip, had to ask for more - why not just give a basket of chips? I've made better dip at home, it had whole pieces of garlic (lazy food prep?) in it, very little flavor or artichokes and wasn't very cheesy.

Tried a glass of sangria - seemed like there was soda water in it or something, not good. First glass of water had something in it, had to ask for another glass - poor service, must check glasses before sending out to table!!!

Positives: Location, waiter was nice despite glass issue, the interior is very cozy, especially the bar area where we sat.

If I come back, I'm sticking to salad or sandwich and glass of wine or beer.

It was chilly in there, could not take my coat off and that's just a minor pet peeve. It was a cold rainy day outside and I could not shake my chill in the cold house like building. We ordered wings, pimento spread , mozzarella sticks and salad.  Boneless wings were tasty but very small, I hate having to pay extra for a few celery sticks and blue cheese... this should be standard. Italian salad was really good with a zingy homemade dressing. Pimento spread was dry and did nothing for me, the pita crackers were tasty. The menu is somewhat limited as is the seating. I will go again in the summer and try the patio and pizza. Server was attentive. No salt and pepper on tables and then the server began to get busy to obtain some.

Great brunch menu with a fantastic Bloody Mary bar that features several infused vodka selections. The decor and ambiance of the bar is amazing and the bartenders are super nice. 

We came back twice in one weekend for drinks just for the friendly atmosphere. It's an affordable place where you feel at home and the bartenders ask your name when you sit gown to get to know you better. We will be back when we come into town.

Place is consistent with good food and decent prices. Menu is typical bar fare with the welcome addition of homemade chips. Cozy patio for warmer weather months. More of a restaurant than a "neighborhood bar." Recently visited during a Cavs game which was played on television but not streamed on the speakers (the restaurant chose to continue to play pandora radio instead). Always enjoy my meals here.

I've been going to Bella Capelli for YEARS, and have been pretty happy.  I took my daughter to get her hair done for a nice back to school treat, since the place is pretty expensive, and they don't offer any type of teen pricing.  But the girl butchered her hair.  It was so uneven, chunks literally missing, and the layers were totally uneven.  When she asked how I liked it I said well it's obviously longer on one side then the other and I don't see any difference in the layers, so it needs to be fixed.  She was a senior stylist so she should know what she was doing, but obviously didn't.  I had to take her to have it recut somewhere else a couple weeks later, because her hair was so embarrassingly bad.  I did call and complain and they offered to recut it, but I said I would never be back.  She basically said well nice having you as a customer, but ok.  I will never go back to Bella Capelli!  Time to find a new place.

Too many chiefs and not enough injuns!  Yes, there are many different kinds of training machines:  Icarian, Life Fitness, Hammer Strength, etc along with treadmills, stair climbers, bikes, free weights.  Combined with an indoor pool, sauna, steam and whirlpool, what more could you want?  How about water coolers that actually cool?  How about a cross trainer machine that has been out of service for 5 weeks now.  How about cleaning the weight machines, mirrors, and glass?  How about some AC in the men's changing room?  It's a shame to see what could be a stellar facility look so filthy.  And all that staff just standing around engrossed in their phones when they could be working on cleaning up the place.  This day and age isn't like the old days of a dingy gym.

Had a horrible experience here.  The girl that waxed my eyebrows took off my entire eyebrow.  Not even exaggerating.  She told me she never did that and acted sorry but the damage was done.  never going here for a wax again.

Went last night for the first time. 
Smelled good upon walking into the restaurant (which had not been updated from the previous owner).  The meat ravioli sounded good.. I asked the waitress if she knew what kind of meat was in the ravioli. She said no.  I asked her if she could  please find out from the chef.  She said "no...no they come in a box" 
Amazed and shocked, looked at my husband and said "is it beef, pork, veal, chicken? hmmm". The waitress said nothing. I ordered the lasagna instead and it arrived in a very hot baking dish, however the temperature of the food was so lukewarm, I was able to eat it right away.  If it's baked correctly, you can't touch it for a while until it cools off. Guess the chef doesn't use his thermometer before the food is served. 
The waitress did come back after I ordered the lasagna and said it's beef in the ravioli and asked if I wanted to change my order. I decided to stick with the Lasagna since I could have gotten ravioli in a box from the grocery store.  
Thanks anyway...never going back!

I could not have asked for a better photographer. Making the Moment made us feel so very special from our first consultation up to our wedding day. Marcus was our photographer and he is incredible. He did our engagement photos which were amazing and we received a ton ofcompliments on them. He was able to capture every vision we had from photos with our dogs, rollerblading to tandem bike riding. Marcus was very organized and helped a immensely when it came to the flow of our big day. Marcus made sure that everyone was where they needed to be and made sure our wedding day ran smoothly. I truly believe the deciding to have MTM do the photography for our wedding was one of the best decisions we have made and we highly recommend them! We cannot wait to see the beautiful images Marcus has captured from our wedding day. Thank you!!

They will never let you cancel the membership. Even after they tell you it is cancelled cancel they will send lawyers after you 2 years later.

Others have said the same thing, i repeat it. Join at your own risk. you have been warned.

I love this pasta.  Pasta is fresh and the portions are large.

I've tried several dishes:

My favorite and a must try is the turkey Bolognese.  It has a great meat to sauce ratio and perfectly coats the noodles.

The spicy shrimp Alfredo is nice and creamy and has a nice kick to it.  Add extra jalapeños if you want it to really kick it up a notch.  

I've also enjoyed the bbq chicken with sweet corn pesto.  This was good but for me its hard to get away from the two dishes mentioned above.

They also have turkey meatballs which are solid and go well with the pomodora  sauce.

The Mac and Cheese is rich and creamy.  I like a little kick so I'd add hot frank's red hot if I took it home.  If I'm eating it there i'll add jalapeños

I phoned to inquire as to membership fees. I spoke to the "Sales Manager". After putting me on hold for two minutes he returned sounding disappointed I hadn't hung up. Rather than a straightforward response, it was like playing a shell game conversationally. 
I further asked about their personal training sessions and prices. Yet another vague answer, "It depends." On what I asked? The time of the day, who the PTrainer was, etc. 
After this, I would RUN, not walk, away from this business.
Went in for drinks.  Smelled terribly. It's like they mopped the whole place down with dirty mop water. Service was ok, but the smell was seriously unbearable.

New store is squeaky clean. Always easy to find my cat standards grain free food & ever clean litter. Great employees Allie is the boss lady, super cool very nice & my old friend now. Mattie works the front and she is the best. 

Open early and late it's great for the consumer like me that runs out of food at the last minute. My cat will let me hear about it all night if necessary. New location in the same plaza makes for easy parking & quick in & out. 

It's basically the best pet store in the world, bc I shop there. 5 stars PICKLES APPROVED CAT STORE
Very disappointed in the food! The cornbread was flavorless and the salad was all lettuce! I would not rush back !
Unfortunately everything about my experience was terrible. The staff is rude and unprofessional. I would avoid this place and save yourself a lot of time, money and pain

I love the food here and the atmosphere. But I ordered the chicken sliders and I got like a pea sized dot of the ranch dressing that's supposed to be on there. Also, she brought an extra ice tea and she said don't worry about it. Which led me to believe it'd be taken off our bill but it wasn't. Also had to ask for lemons for the calamari. I didn't see any peppers with that like the menu mentioned. Do they run out of stuff and just pass it off as complete?

You should know that I don't just hand out 5 star reviews.  I really do save those for the BEST of the BEST, in my opinion anyways.  I can't believe no one has reviewed my fantabulous wedding photographer yet, so here you go.

We hired Making the Moment for our wedding on April 9, 2011.  Our initial meeting was with Brett, the owner.  He answered all our questions and was incredibly friendly & helpful.  We looked through all the photographer's portfolios and decided we liked Vince's style the most.

Our wedding was slightly offbeat...we were married in a theater and had a movie theme, because we are big time movie nerds.  Vince totally embraced this, even staying up late the night before the wedding to watch Pulp Fiction (which he knew was our favorite film and would be referenced many times that day).  I have nothing but positive things to say about our day with him, our own private paparazzi!  He was enthusiastic, artistic, and helpful.  The ceremony music started way before I was ready and I had both my maid of honor and Vince lying on the floor, buckling my shoes for me.  Now THAT is a selfless photographer!  

We were like kids waiting for Christmas as we waited for our photo preview several weeks later.  It was, of course, worth the wait.  We had a "premiere night" with owner Brett at Making the Moment HQ (aka Brett's house).  He set out wine and fancy snacks for us as we viewed our photos.  His excitement about our images matched our own, and we were all pretty giddy as we watched the slide show.

Overall, this is some of the best customer service I've ever received ANYWHERE.  If I can give any brides and/or grooms-to-be advice, it's to splurge on your photos, and hire a photographer that shares your vision.  If you're in Northeast Ohio, hire Making the Moment.  You will not regret it.  I certainly don't hope to get married again any time soon, but I do hope to get the chance to work with them again!

When it first opened, Sweet Basil was my 'go to' pizza place.  The pizza was flavorful and used high quality ingredients.  You would walk in to see dough being thrown and a smiling face, but the last two times have been an utter disappointment.  The first I chalked up to a bad night but it repeated and seems to be standard.  For a small salad and 12 inch pepperoni and mushroom, I was charged $23.  There was a total of 8 pepperoni and small bits of mushrooms.  Further insult to injury was a lack of cheese but strangely a lot of grease.  It was enough to make the two of us not hungry...but not for very long.  The sauce was good and seemed high quality but the price and lack of toppings made me feel ripped off.  I should have gone to fatheads and got twice the pizza for half the price.  Skip this place unless you have money burning a hole in your pocket.

Tasty Chicken shwarma sandwhich, had a nice kick. Companion had a falfel sandwich and discribed it as perfectly prepared and the house-made pickeled turnips were a bonus.  Would have been five stars if they offerd soup.

We've been to the Strongsville location, but this was the first time at the Westlake location. First, this place does take call ahead so, if you want to go on a Saturday evening, learn from us and call ahead. 
I really like this place! The menu has a lot of options, something for everyone.  By the time we got to the table, we were pretty hungry. So we ordered the tomato basil flatbread and the sushi shots. While they were being prepped, they brought some delicious bread and butter to the table. 
The flatbread and sushi shots were good! The sushi shots had tuna, avocado, and came in a crunchy shell. They tasted clean and fresh. The flatbread had a pesto on it which was very flavorful. The crust was thin but also soft. For dinner I got the tomato bisque and a side of sweet potato fries. Both were good but I actually enjoyed the apps more. My hubs got the veggie burger which was really soft but had a good mix of bbq sauce and mustard. Very large portion. 
I'm the end, I still really like Rosewood. The food is good and the service is good and the prices are decent. We'll definitely be back to the Westlake location, but next time, we'll call ahead.

This business needs a negative rating. My husband ordered flowers for his mother for Mother's Day. As of today June 1st the flowers have still not arrived. He has called numerous times being told that the flowers were delivered, or that they would check into the issue and call back but they never call back. He has asked for a refund or for the flowers to be delivered and neither has happened. Do not order from this company unless you like to give your money away!

One of the best sit down pizza places in the area! The pizza is thin crust style and huge! They offer a variety of flavors and the option to customize your own. They also have several beer options. The price is moderate and the staff is friendly. The only downfall is the often slow service. It's small inside, so you might have to wait for a table on a busy Friday or Saturday evening. Overall, great place to grab a drink and pizza.

Took my car here because it was overheating. The mechanic called and told me I would need the water pump, thermostat, and everything surrounding replaced and it would cost 1650$. Ended up getting fixed for 300$ just a small fix.

Went back for routine oil change did a fine job. Recommend coming here for any routine maintenance not for any larger issues.

I thought my spicy shrimp alfredo tasted like mac and cheese. I know they make it fresh but I waited almost thirty minutes for my food. Also, I think it is pricey for such a small bowl. I expected a bigger portion for $10. I usually love all things pasta, but I wasn't completely satisfied with my experience here.

Bartender was slow and poured really weak drinks. I would be surprised if there was an honest shot in there. Her give-a-crap meter was about zero. 

I ordered a steak salad and it was like eating a retread that had recently been torn off of a tire through excessive road wear. 

My date ordered an aki bowl. If you are from California, or have ever eaten a bowl before and liked it, don't order it here. 

This place sucked.

They are amazing! I had a Warranty Repair Issue with a Zipper Closure on my Victorinox Luggage. Victorinox directed me to them as the only location in Northeast Ohio authorized to do the repair. I reached out by phone to confirm this. Extremely helpful and polite which was encouraging. When I arrived and they examined the Luggage. They would need to have the replacement part shipped. Given that I travel 40 weeks a year and had a trip the following week, I did not leave my case for fear the part would not arrive in time. I crossed my fingers that the zipper would hold out until the part came in and my schedule would allow for the repair. They called me that the parts arrived just a few days later! They were so kind and gracious to allow me to drop off my Luggage with a promise it would be done in time for my next trip. They were true to their word! Perfect Repair and Done When Promised! I Highly Recommend them! They even proactively ordered a set of replacement pieces should I have this issue occur again. That is Customer Service!

I will never be back to this salon. I came in for a basic haircut, and I asked for a trim all around, with my bangs an inch below my chin and to keep the "V" shape to the back. At the salon i noticed she cut off at least an inch more than i asked, but i didn't say anything because i figured it wasn't worth it and its not like she could take it back. It wasn't until i got home that my roommate asked why my hair is so uneven. I looked in the mirror and the left side of my bangs were at least an inch shorter than the right side!! Huge difference! And its not like my hair was parted a different way while cutting. I asked for it to be parted down the center and cut like that because that's how i wear it. So now my left side starts an inch ABOVE my chin, and my right side starts at my chin! I look absolutely ridiculous. I cannot believe i didn't inspect her cut more after she did it. So now i have to wear ponytails until my hair is long enough to be fixed. I am seriously sick to my stomach over this. I will never be back nor recommend your salon.

I really enjoyed this chocolate shop. The young woman behind the counter was really nice and provided suggestions. I tried the peanut butter cup, a macadamia brittle-thingy, a chocolate-covered oreo, and some chocolate-covered pretzels. All were great. It's not as charming as Malley's or as boutique as Lilly's, but it is a good alternative while in Crocker Park.

I joined the gym 2 weeks ago. They have an outdoor pool in Westlake and Broadview Heights. Both pools are not opened and the whirlpool is not working at Broadview Heights. They don't know when the pool will open or the whirlpool.  They are not giving me what I paid for. I called to cancel my membership. I wanted a full refund. I explained why. I paid $ 214.92 for 1 year. I was told by a manager they wouln't refund any of my money because it was longer than 3 days since I signed up. I was never told that I only had 3 days to get a refund if I changed my mind. I was told by a Westlake employee that's not my job. I can't help you. I do not recommend FX Fitness. You do not get what you paid for. The gym is unreliable. I would like to give them zero stars but since I have to pick one I rate them at one star.

Annmarie

Stopped in here for the first time to grab a quick dinner and a beer, and not run into anyone we knew.  We were greeted warmly by megan the bartender and a couple other customers. 5 minutes after we ordered some good friends came in... this small bar just got bigger and friendlier! I couldn't decide what to order from the fantastic list of homemade pizzas, so megan helped create a delicious roasted garlic, cheese, argula pizza that i can't wait to go back and order again!! The smashed garlic was over the top,  crust perfectly crisp and chewy,  topped with a beautiful argula salad..yum! New great lake beers on tap, great food, customer service... can't wait to come back... .and then look forward to summer on the patio

TLDR: MS needs to up-level the quality of the food (as you'll see mentioned in several other reviews).  Atmosphere and service were good. 

Coffee: Not very good. 

Small cup of chili: Tasty but was overpriced at $5.50.  It had a nice kick to it.  I might order this again.

Blackened Tuna Salad:  Description called out a salad of "mixed greens".  I'm not sure why restaurants in Cleveland think people want to eat a mix of iceberg and romain hearts.  I would have preferred a nice spring mix or spinach salad which would have complimented the tuna much better. Ordered the tuna medium rare and it came out medium.  The seasoning on the tuna was so salty it completely ruined the dish.  I found the balsamic dressing overpowering and left it on the side. 

Overall they have the bones of a good restaurant but need to improve the quality of the cooking.

Best cake balls ever.  We hired them to make a wedding cake and cake balls.  She set up the table with desserts,  cake,  candy and pretty dishes we gave her.  It looked beautiful and tasted delicious!

Worst gym I've ever been to. Its dirty, terrible staff, dark, and they constantly charge you random things, which will then lead to you calling and talking to someone on the phone who has no idea what they're doing.

As a New Yorker transplanted here in Westlake, I can honestly say that this is the best pizza west of the NJ shore.  Don't mess it up with too many toppings - you need to taste the sauce.  True, it is not foldable with melted dripping cheese like Martio's in Nanuet, but it sure comes in a close second.  The menu is pretty limited, so I only go there once a month.  But if you want great pizza on the west side, go no further.

Was disputing for weeks a $100 charge from FX Fitness Westlake for personal training that came out of nowhere. And yes, I completely understood the cancellation policy. Finally got a manager to say he'll issue the refund after proving it was completely wrong I was charged. It has never shown back up in my account so I call to follow up and that manager is no longer with the company. I try to start the fight again for the money they stole and now my cancellation paperwork is "missing," the new manager wouldn't look at any of my proof, I ask for a corporate number and he writes down the number of the exact same facility I'm standing in! Look them up on the BBB to file a complaint and they have 1 star! Life lesson to do your homework before signing a contract. Hope you feel good about yourselves #fxfitnesswestlake stealing $100 from a single mom.

Rented from them twice, first time they stole a brand new tarp, would not reimburse, the second time they were 5 days late!!  On top of that, it had exactly the same materials in it as the first time, same size container, and I was charged an additional $400 on my credit card a month later with no notice.  Do not rent from them!

Sat at the bar on a Wednesday. Wasn't crowded. Bar tenders were horrible. Had to ask for another drink since they were messing around. Appetizer took 30 min to come out and was average at best. Calamari tasted like oil hadn't been changed in some time.  After being served our salad I asked for a side of dressing because the salad had not been tossed well. 15 min later the bartender went back and had the second bartender bring it out. 1st and last time...ps, shouldn't have to ask to have the Cavs game on either. You are in Cleveland ya goofs.. Almost forgot the best part , the $15 salmon salad had goldfish crackers in it... On purpose. Assuming Cisco miss picked them and they decided to use it . Morons
I had a bad experience and the general manager called me to talk and it made all the difference in the world.  The best cut I've had there is with Nancy Bruce.
The Surf & Turf Burger brings me back, again and again. Highly recommended.
Excellent service and delicious food. The chicken shawarma was well marinated and grilled. Ordering tea after the meal was refreshing and relaxing. Environment was good, and the people were friendly.

I called Classic Floors to get an installation estimate for hardwood floors.  I gave them detailed information on my project, including the room dimensions. I was told an estimator needed to view the house and the first appointment was a week away. So I scheduled a day/time for an estimator to view the project in my home.

Tina called the day before to confirm my appointment.

Then on the SAME day as my appointment, a man called to cancel. He had reviewed the details of my project and it would not be worth his time to do the work.  Then he gave me a quote over the phone (without looking at the area) that was over 5 x greater than other estimates I received.

In summary, I found it very unprofessional Classic Floors would cancel last minute (when they had a week to review my project). Also I found it unethical I received an estimate that was not realistic.

I will not be recommending Classic Floors to my friends and family!

This bar is amazing! Not only is the atmosphere warm and welcoming, but the food is delicious. The brussel sprouts are to die for and the pizza is made to order. They specialize in pizza, wings and fried chicken and it's perfect! Not typical bar food that can be found at any bar.  A Cozy and comfortable Cheers type bar where everyone knows your name! Sure to be a crazy success!! 

The owners Julie, Wil and Eric are so welcoming! Here's to many years of friendly neighborhood love and friendship!!
Horrible experience waiting for HOURS with my eight year old daughter who needed stitches in her head. Horribly rude and very unhelpful staff made for a terrible night in the ER.

This gym is dirty and cannot be safe. They are always out of sanitizer, paper towels etc... The pool and the saunas looks like it's never been cleaned. I pretty sure mold is growing. In a stall in the dressing room there has been a swim liner stuck on wall for 3 yrs. why do I have a membership. I keep hoping 1 day they'll clean it. No cleans the equipment. I'm surprise no has caught anything from this gym. It's disgusting. I'm calling the health board.
